topic: How to implement stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to implement stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Stream Processing using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an overview of implementing real-time data stream processing using FastAPI, a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs, and Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand the concept of Stream Processing in real-time data analysis
Learn how to leverage FastAPI for building efficient APIs
Utilize Python 3.12+'s new features for stream processing efficiency
Implement a streaming endpoint in FastAPI
Handle concurrent requests and data streams

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, WebSocket
app = FastAPI()

socket = app.websocket('/stream')
def socket_connection(websocket: WebSocket):
    async for message in websocket:
        await websocket.send_text(f'You sent: {message}')

version_notes: Python 3.12+'s improved performance and new features allow for more efficient stream processing
FastAPI version 0.69.0 or later is recommended for building streaming endpoints
caveats: Ensure to handle concurrent requests properly in your FastAPI application
Streaming data may lead to resource consumption, so optimize accordingly
